page.title: 02Homes and home lifes
page.content: the field. Then I go and feed the calves some cake and give them some hay and cereal. After I have had my breakfast I go over the road with Dad to give the bullocks some hay . Then we go back home and Dad does some muck-spreading." Lynne: "I live at 2, Sixbells, Westbury-on-Severn. You can see the river from the top of Wintles Hill. I live in a semi-detached house and we are having an extension built on the back of it. It is called Sixbells because you can see the Westbury church spire with six bells in it. There are fields at the back of the house and a playing field, hall and cricket ground opposite us. There is a farm over the main road and up Wintles Hill there are a few houses and two bus stops."
